column226: I know not; nor did you know, and no one spoke of it; but you did not separate from each other as though nothing had happened.
column227: To love thus is to love according to the soul; and there is no soul that does not respond to this love.
column228: For the soul of man is a guest that has gone hungry these centuries back, and never has it to be summoned twice to the nuptial feast.
column229: The souls of all our brethren are ever hovering about us, craving for a caress, and only waiting for the signal.
column230: But how many beings there are who all their life long have not dared make such a signal!
column231: It is the disaster of our entire existence that we live thus away from our soul, and stand in such dread of its slightest movement.
column232: Did we but allow it to smile frankly in its silence and its radiance, we should be already living an eternal life.
column233: We have only to think for an instant how much it succeeds in accomplishing during those rare moments when we knock off its chains--for it is our custom to enchain it as though it were distraught--what it does in love, for instance, for there we do permit it at times to approach the lattices of external life.
column234: And would it not be in accordance with the primal truth if all men were to feel that they were face to face with each other, even as the woman feels with the man she loves?
column235: This invisible and divine goodness, of which I only speak here because of its being one of the surest and nearest signs of the unceasing activity of our soul, this invisible and divine goodness ennobles, in decisive fashion, all that it has unconsciously touched.
column236: Let him who has a grievance against his fellow, descend into himself and seek out whether he never has been good in the presence of that fellow.
column237: For myself, I have never met any one by whose side I have felt my invisible goodness bestir itself, without he has become, at that very instant, better than myself.
column238: Be good at the depths of you, and you will discover that those who surround you will be good even to the same depths.
column239: Nothing responds more infallibly to the secret cry of goodness than the secret cry of goodness that is near.
column240: While you are actively good in the invisible, all those who approach you will unconsciously do things that they could not do by the side of any other man.
column241: Therein lies a force that has no name; a spiritual rivalry that knows no resistance.
column242: It is as though this were the actual place where is the sensitive spot of our soul; for there are souls that seem to have forgotten their existence and to have renounced everything that enables the being to rise; but, once touched here, they all draw themselves erect; and in the divine plains of the secret goodness, the most humble of souls cannot endure defeat.
column243: And yet it is possible that nothing is changing in the life one sees; but is it only that which matters, and is our existence indeed confined to actions we can take in our hand like stones on the highroad?
column244: If you ask yourself, as we are told we should ask every evening, "what of immortal have I done to-day?"
